sn1.12:3.3: “Attachment” here is upadhi, which is both the things of the world to which we cling, and the inner clinging (see Snp 1.2, SN 12.66). The Jains defined upadhi similarly (Tattvārthasūtra 9.26). The dominant meaning in Sanskrit is “fraud”, which perhaps informs the Buddhist sense: the things we attach to give a false sense of security.
